Auth service returning intermittent 500 errors. ~5% of login attempts failing.

*Incident Commander*: @James Liu
*Comms Lead*: @Emily Watson
Initial investigation: Redis connection pool showing exhaustion. Current pool size is 50, seeing 200+ waiting connections.
Deployed hotfix to increase pool size to 200. Monitoring error rates.
Error rate down to 0.1%. Continuing to monitor.

âœ… *INCIDENT RESOLVED*

*Duration*: 1 hour 8 minutes
*Root Cause*: Redis connection pool exhaustion
*Resolution*: Increased pool size
*Follow-up*: PLAT-1250 created for auto-scaling

Team, we need to finalize the new pricing tiers before the board meeting. Current proposal:

â€¢ *Starter*: $12/user/mo (was $10)
â€¢ *Professional*: $20/user/mo (no change)
â€¢ *Enterprise*: Custom (no change)

Thoughts?
From sales perspective, the increase on Starter is fine - most competitors are at $12-15 for similar features. Happy we're keeping Pro at $20.
CS is supportive. The Starter customers most price-sensitive are on annual anyway, so they get the 20% discount.
Great, sounds like we have alignment. I'll update the pricing doc and we'll implement Feb 1 for new customers, existing customers grandfathered for 6 months.

We need to make a call on the notification service rewrite. Options:

1. *Keep Postgres* - Add partitioning, 3 weeks
2. *Migrate to Kafka* - Better scalability, 6 weeks

Engineering leads, please weigh in by EOD Thursday.
Leaning toward Kafka. We're hitting Postgres limits at 10k notifications/min. With mobile push coming, we'll easily 10x that.
Agree with James. Kafka also gives us replay capability for debugging.
From mobile side, we need the higher throughput. Kafka gets my vote.
Consensus on Kafka. @James Liu will lead. Kicking off next sprint. Thanks everyone! ðŸŽ‰
Just got off a call with Globex ($18.5k MRR). They're asking about SSO group sync - auto-provision users based on AD groups. Is this on the roadmap?
It's in the Q2 roadmap! We've heard this from 5 other enterprise accounts. Target is April.
Can we get early access for Globex? They've been great beta partners.
Absolutely. I'll add them to the beta cohort. @Lisa Park can you set expectations for mid-March beta?
Heads up - three enterprise customers mentioned mobile app performance in their QBRs this week. Specifically the large project crash issue.
We're aware - it's MOB-892. It's affecting projects with 500+ tasks on older iPhones. We're prioritizing it for this sprint.
Thanks Alex. Can I tell them to expect a fix in the next 2 weeks?
Yes, that's a safe timeline. We'll have a beta build ready by end of next week.
